result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J Carolfi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tyler J Carolfi is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tyler J Carolfi was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours community service per week.
No contact with victim, Schuette Metals.

DNA sample.  

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler J Carolfi

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

8:35 a.m.
Clerk:  Micki. 

State appears by ADA Hannah Runde. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Natasha VanLieshout.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to:
COUNT 2: Burglary - Building or Dwelling >> DISMISSED OUTRIGHT.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
COUNT 1: Theft - Movable Property (<=$2500) >> NO CONTEST.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week; Restitution to Schuette Metals in the amount of $517.00 and 10% surcharge; No contact with victim: Schuette Metals; DNA sample and surcharge; and CC. Zero days jail credit.

ADJ: 8:46 a.m.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
